Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Interface Power

All Known Implementing Classes:
BlockMoveUp, BuildBeforeMove, BuildDomeEverywhere, BuildUnderfoot, CanMoveUp, Down2Win, EndRemoveNeighbour, ExtraBuild, ExtraMove, MovePush, MoveSwap, NoWinPerimeter, PowerDecorator, StandardPower
public interface Power
Power is the interface responsible for implementing the god's power. This interface is used to implement the pattern decorator.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Error> checkBuild​(Worker w, int x, int y, int l)
    This method checks if a worker can build in a given square.

    This method checks if moving the worker to a given square is a legit move
    boolean checkWin​(Worker w)
    This method checks if the player has won
    boolean endOfTurn​(java.util.ArrayList<Worker> workers)
    This method is called when a player finish his turn.
    Board getBoard()
    This method return the current board
    void updateBuild​(Worker w, int x, int y, int l)
    This method is called only if the checkBuild was successful, it updates the model saving the player's build
    void updateMove​(Worker w, int x, int y)
    This method is called only if the checkMove was successful, it updates the model saving the player's move.

  • Method Details

    • checkMove

      java.util.ArrayList<Error> checkMove​(Worker w, int x, int y)
      This method checks if moving the worker to a given square is a legit move
      Parameters:
      w - is the worker that wants to move
      x - is the x square coordinate where the worker wants to move
      y - is the y square coordinate where the worker wants to move
      Returns:
      an ArrayList that is empty if the move is legal, otherwise it contains the errors that prevent the worker from moving.

    • checkBuild

      java.util.ArrayList<Error> checkBuild​(Worker w, int x, int y, int l)
      This method checks if a worker can build in a given square.
      Parameters:
      w - is the worker that wants to build
      x - is the x square coordinate where the worker wants to build
      y - is the y square coordinate where the worker wants to build
      l - is the level the worker wants to build
      Returns:
      an ArrayList that is empty if the build is legal, otherwise it contains the errors that prevent the worker from building.

    • checkWin

      boolean checkWin​(Worker w)
      This method checks if the player has won
      Returns:
      true or false to indicate if the player has won

    • updateMove

      void updateMove​(Worker w, int x, int y)
      This method is called only if the checkMove was successful, it updates the model saving the player's move.
      Parameters:
      w - is the worker that moves
      x - is the x square coordinate where the worker moves
      y - is the y square coordinate where the worker moves

    • updateBuild

      void updateBuild​(Worker w, int x, int y, int l)
      This method is called only if the checkBuild was successful, it updates the model saving the player's build
      Parameters:
      w - is the worker that builds
      x - is the x square coordinate where the worker builds
      y - is the y square coordinate where the worker builds
      l - is the level the worker builds

    • getBoard

      Board getBoard()
      This method return the current board
      Returns:
      the current instance of Board

    • endOfTurn

      boolean endOfTurn​(java.util.ArrayList<Worker> workers)
      This method is called when a player finish his turn. It checks that player has done standard moves and reset all counters or flag for the turn in model.
      Parameters:
      workers - is the arrayList of worker that player uses
      Returns:
      true : The turn is correctly finish false : The turn cannot finish now
